item.title: Palo Alto Networks warns of another firewall vulnerability under attack by hackers
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The US cybersecurity giant says hackers are exploiting the high-severity flaw to break into unpatched customer networks.

item.title: Guidde taps AI to help create software training videos
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Creating corporate training videos for software is a time-consuming ordeal, especially if you’re an organization with a lot of software licenses. Training videos can help get employees up to speed, but they’re a big lift. They often take entire teams to produce. Tel Aviv-based entrepreneur Yoav Einav thought there might be an alternative, cheaper way […]

item.title: A former Etsy product manager built an AI-powered app for new parents
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Career product manager Amanda DeLuca has launched a parenting management app, Riley, born out of her own experience with parental anxiety and feedback from other families. DeLuca, who previously at Google, Nerdwallet, and Eventbrite, in addition to Etsy, became pregnant three years ago. At the time, she and her husband, who is also a product […]

item.title: X doubles its Premium+ plan prices after xAI releases Grok 3
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Hours after Elon Musk’s AI company xAI released the latest version of its AI model, Grok 3, X has significantly hiked the price for its top Premium+ subscription plan, which gives users access to the latest model, to almost $50 per month. On the support page that lists X’s premium plans, the monthly subscription price […]

item.title: Hyundai’s new Tesla charging port comes up short
item.dc:creator: Emme Hall
item.description:
The 2025 Hyundai Ioniq 5 is as good as ever, but doesn’t play well with Tesla Superchargers at the moment.

item.title: Kuda and CEO face allegations of sex discrimination and unfair dismissal from former executive, per filing
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description:
An employment tribunal case has placed Kuda Technologies, one of Africa’s fastest-growing digital banks, under scrutiny over allegations of workplace discrimination, harassment, and wrongful dismissal. Rosemary Hewat, Kuda’s former Group Chief People Officer (CPO), filed a complaint accusing the company and its CEO, Babatunde Ogundeyi, of sex discrimination, victimization, and unfair dismissal. According to the […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Pokémon Go maker Niantic is reportedly selling its games division
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Niantic, the company behind the popular augmented reality game Pokémon Go, is looking to sell its game development business, Bloomberg reported.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Humane’s AI Pin is dead, as HP buys startup’s assets for $116M
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Humane announced on Tuesday that most of its assets have been acquired by HP for $116 million. The hardware startup is immediately discontinuing sales of its $499 AI Pins. Humane alerted customers who have already purchased the Pin that their devices will stop functioning before the end of the month — at 12 p.m. PST […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Trump admin reverses hydropower layoffs that sparked grid stability fears
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The layoffs slashed between 13% to 20% of the four Power Marketing Administrations’ workforces.

item.title: Google Play Books purchases on iOS now skirt the App Store’s commission
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Google has gained permission to sell its e-books and audiobooks directly to customers through its iOS app, Google Play Books. While iOS apps today can offer access to content previously purchased elsewhere, like e-books bought via a website, developers have to request a specific exception to link their iOS app’s users to the company’s own […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Duolingo ‘killed’ its mascot with a Cybertruck, and it’s going weirdly well
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Duolingo’s mascot, Duo the owl, is dead. Okay, Duo isn’t really dead (we think), but the language learning app committed so hard to this bit that its CEO, Luis von Ahn, read a eulogy for this beloved green bird on TikTok. As any fiction author could probably tell you, killing everyone’s favorite character is not […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Elon Musk staffer created a DOGE AI assistant for making government ‘less dumb’
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet, Zack Whittaker
item.description:
A senior Elon Musk staffer created a custom AI chatbot that's supposed to help DOGE "eliminate" government waste.

item.title: Apple purges apps without contact info from EU app store, as DSA deadline hits
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
A change requiring app developers to disclose their address, phone number, and email information to consumers has gone live on the App Store within the European Union. Apple on Tuesday announced it has removed any EU apps that haven’t yet complied with the Digital Services Act (DSA), a regulation that had added a requirement in […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Safe Superintelligence, Ilya Sutskever’s AI startup, is reportedly close to raising roughly $1B
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Safe Superintelligence, an AI startup founded by former OpenAI chief scientist Ilya Sutskever, could be close to raising more than $1 billion at a $30 billion valuation — a higher valuation than reported just weeks ago. Bloomberg reports that VC firm Greenoaks Capital Partners is leading the deal and pledging to invest half a billion […]

item.title: Amazon, Microsoft, and Exxon want to make scandal-plagued carbon markets more trustworthy
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
A task force, organized by the Bipartisan Policy Center think tank, is hoping to improve credibility of voluntary carbon markets.

item.title: Thinking Machines Lab is ex-OpenAI CTO Mira Murati’s new startup
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Former OpenAI CTO Mira Murati has announced her new startup. Unsurprisingly, it’s focused on AI. Called Thinking Machines Lab, the startup, which came out of stealth today, intends to build tooling to “make AI work for [people’s] unique needs and goals,” and to create AI systems that are “more widely understood, customizable, and generally capable” […]

The VC firm has $90 billion in assets under management and invested in several unicorn cybersecurity startups

Welcome to TechCrunch Fintech!  This week we’re looking at some big valuation jumps, how Stripe is eyeing another shareholder sale, a colorful conversation with an early-stage VC, and more! item.title: Fiverr wants gig workers to offload some of their work to AI
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Gig marketplace Fiverr wants to let freelancers train AI on their bodies of work and use it to automate future jobs. At an event on Tuesday, Fiverr announced the launch of several new efforts aimed at attracting gig workers to its platform and equipping them with generative AI tools. Perhaps the most ambitious is a […]

item.title: Facebook now only stores live videos for 30 days, will delete old broadcasts
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Facebook announced on Tuesday that live videos will now only be stored on the social network for 30 days, after which they will be deleted. Previously, these videos were stored indefinitely. The change goes into effect on Wednesday. All live videos that are currently older than 30 days will be removed from the platform as […]
